results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard L. Berman, Glen Howard, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.

results.title: Coelenterates (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Focuses on a hydra capturing a daphnia. Compares the reproduction methods of the hydra and obelia. Shows closeups of the physalia and limestone producing polyps in stony corals. Written and photographed by Bruce J. Russell.

results.title: Coelenterata
results.brief_description: This film should be sued in conjunction with the film “hydra coelenterata” shows the structure and behaviours of relation organisms, including examples of the colonial hydrozoan and of the large jellyfish belonging to the scyphozoa and of their alternate generation, the scyphistoma. The anthozoan are represented by anemones, sea-pens, etc and the ctenophora by the common comb-jelly, pleuro-brachia.

results.title: Codling strikes at dusk
results.brief_description: Shows the fight against the codling moth, a pest which costs Australia about $2,000,000 each year. The film illustrates the life cycle of the moth; eggs laid in the calix of hard fruit become larvae, eat into the fruit, and finally enter the dormant chrysalid stage. Metamorphosed into moths, they lay eggs to complete the cycle - twice each year. Shows the ways in which the moth is introduced into unaffected areas.

results.title: Code Names (2001-present)
results.brief_description: Trevor Paglen’s Code Names exists as a list of words, phrases and terms that designate classified military programs. These include classified exercises and units, intelligence programs, information compartments and Pentagon “Special Access Programs.” Installed in downtown Syracuse, Code Names functions as a meditation on language and advertising whose product is foreign to the general population. The contents of the piece become metaphors for the unknown and ask the audience to ponder what exactly they mean.

constellations_other.name: Orwell & Snowden
constellations_other.description: Explores Orwell as a representation of the NSA, and the infamous Snowden leak.

results.title: Code name Snake's Eye
results.brief_description: A story of a marine commando exercise; a combined operation of ships, planes, frogmen and commandos. A coastal town with the code name “Snake’s Eye” is the objective. Frogmen-parachutists drop from the sky and set to work under the sea; waves of strike aircraft are catapulted into action from a carrier; mass troops are landed by naval helicopters and assault landing craft; commandos are seen taking part in a breathtaking cliff-assault. The action demonstrates the astonishing versatility of the men of the Royal Marines as they go into combat on land, at sea and in the air.

results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Pascal Guilloux, AFTRS, Moira Moss and Andrew O'Sullivan
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.

results.title: Coda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
Part Six of the Orchestra series which describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th century to the present. Jane Glover looks at the work of an orchestra in detail. Taking the score of Ravel’s “Bolero” she works through it with the London Symphony Orchestra. Today the conductor is as much a “star” as the orchestra itself. Jane Glover discusses just what the conductor does to deserve this stardom.

results.title: Cocoa harvest
results.brief_description: The film shows the method of harvesting cocoa in the Gold Coast region of West Africa, including scenes of village life, sacks of beans on their way to the depot for grading and weighing, and finally transport by train and truck to the coast to be loaded on to ocean going steamers for export.
